data.title: Important Historic Building
data.text: Effectively restored and preserved as an educational museum this site explains important government history.  A number of rooms contain specific effective displays, many with video presentations geared toward school groups but interesting to all.  We spent about an hour walking through the building and displays.  A parking structure is located about a block away just northwest of the capitol complex.  The adjacent 22-story modern capitol building is also worth a brief self-guided tour.  Be sure to check out the observation deck on the top floor for excellent views.

data.title: Excellent visit
data.text: We spent a morning here during a recent visit to Tallahassee. As we're English we didn't know a great deal about Florida history and we learnt a lot both about general history and the political system. Staff were very helpful and pleasant.

data.title: Step inot the past
data.text: Both the facts of Florida's history as told in rooms where much of it happened and the story of how researchers worked on restoring the historic capitol are well presented. If you think of Florida only as palm trees and beaches and Disney, this will be your wake up call to learn more.

data.title: Cute Museum!
data.text: Great free way to spend an afternoon! Great if you're short on time, or have a few hours to kill. You just wander around on your own and there's lots of things to read and watch.

data.title: Florida History
data.text: We spent a couple of hours viewing the exhibits here.  Enjoyed the introductory film.  Probably more interesting for Florida residents.

data.title: Not a bad little museum.
data.text: It's in the old capitol, a charming old (1845) building, and it's a good way to learn about the history of Florida.

data.title: Beautiful step back in history.
data.text: Well preserved building, excellent and friendly docents to greet you upon entry.( I believe the gentleman's name that personally greeted me was James Smith.) They tell you all the pertinent info (bathrooms, etc) when you first go in so there is no room for confusion on your self-guided tour. Interactive, as they have a designated area where you can sit in one of the legislative chamber rooms. Free admission, meticulously landscaped grounds, easily accessible from all the local downtown hotels. Worth a visit just to see the beautiful rotunda ceiling, the candy-cane striped awnings, and the stately columns flanked by palm trees.

data.title: Historic building well restored
data.text: Well worth a visit to learn about Florida's history and role of state government. Excellent introduction from young woman at the desk. Selfie opportunity in state rooms.

data.title: Learn about this building and florida history
data.text: This is a wonderful place to understand the fascinating history of Florida...good for all ages.  Staff is helpful, store available for postcards and other souvenirs.

data.title: Tour of the Old Capital
data.text: This is a wonderful historic museum. Not only do they offer a learning experience but you can rent the famility for business meetings and events.They also host family fun nights!

data.title: Fun quick visit while in town
data.text: While waiting for an FSU football game on a Saturday afternoon, we thought we would check out the old capital. My son is a history fanatic and loved it. It took us a little over an hour to walk through the entire thing. It was worth the time!

data.title: Very nice building, easy to see in an hour or 2
data.text: The building is certainly nice. However, it is not too big and you can easily see everything in an hour to 1.5 hours.

data.title: Very interesting facts about early Florida Government
data.text: This building, they call the old Capital has beautiful architectural  features and is located right next to the 22 story " new" built in the 1970's Capital. Lots of interesting historical facts about early Florida Government.

data.title: Beautiful old building with nicely preserved artifacts in original rooms
data.text: Be sure to leave plenty of time to see all these exhibits and enjoy the introductory video as well as other videos scattered around the separate rooms.  Very friendly visitor desk man whose enthusiasm for the place rubs off easily on you.

data.title: Unexpected treasure
data.text: The two very cheerful ladies greeting us provided guidance of what there is to see in the historical displays in this old Capitol.  They even had two levels of scavenger hunt for the kids.  Worthwhile stop.  Very interesting.

data.title: Florida Capitol Museum
data.text: Even though they didn't have a tour guide, it was very interesting to wonder around with my family. It is very educational. If you like history, politics, etc. its a must place to visit in Tallahassee!

data.title: Good history of Florida
data.text: Suprisingly an interesting historical review of the state of Florida from colonization through current.  Exhibits were well presented and labeled.  Museum is free with request for donation.  Can spend an easy hour or two going through.

data.title: Personal assistance with a wonderful touch
data.text: This museum was not only very well  but had a wonderful assistant to give you advice  information on this wonderful piece of history.  This museum was been well cared for and gives back to the people who visit.  We found the history of this city all in one place.  Great job.

data.title: Florida Capitol Museum
data.text:
Florida's Capitol Museum is an enlightening educational experience that brings back memories for me of starting my career with the State of Florida and auditing Florida Government Cabinet members in that Old Capitol Building very early in my 34-year career. The guided tour is superb and professionally conducted.
This stop is well worth including in a visit to Tallahassee.

data.title: A highlight to Tallahassee thecold capital building
data.text: A must see when in Tallahassee - old Florida - not like other old state capital buildings do go inside and tour
